content:
Diagnosis
	1. Mixed acinar-endocrine carcinoma of pancreatic head
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not suitable - locally advanced at presentation

	Chemotherapy
	1. FOLFIRINOX 4 cycles Jan-Mar 2024
	2. Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel commenced April 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging with mixed response in liver metastases

	Current issues
	Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy
Intermittent vomiting
Weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today who has been receiving second-line gemcitabine/nab-paclitaxel for metastatic pancreatic mixed acinar-endocrine carcinoma. Unfortunately, she has developed significant peripheral neuropathy affecting both hands and feet (grade 3), which is significantly impacting her quality of life. She reports difficulties with fine motor tasks and is experiencing constant tingling and numbness up to her knees.

Her most recent CT scan from 15/5/24 shows stable disease in the pancreatic primary (6.2cm vs 6.3cm) with mixed response in liver metastases - two lesions have reduced in size while one has increased from 2.1cm to 2.8cm. Lung metastases remain stable. Her CA19-9 has risen slightly from 850 to 920.

Given the significant neuropathy and somewhat equivocal disease response, we have discussed changing treatment strategy. We will discontinue nab-paclitaxel and continue with single-agent gemcitabine at full dose. I have explained this offers a reasonable balance between disease control and quality of life.

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 8 weeks
CA19-9 monitoring with each cycle

	Medication prescribed
	Gabapentin dose increased to 300mg TDS for neuropathy
Metoclopramide 10mg TDS PRN continued

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre-cycle 2 modified regimen

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function
Titrate gabapentin dose as needed for neuropathy symptoms

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable pancreatic primary (6.2cm vs 6.3cm) with mixed response in liver metastases, stable lung metastases
Discontinued nab-paclitaxel due to grade 3 peripheral neuropathy, continuing single-agent gemcitabine

patient_facts.value: Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet up to knees
CT 15/5/24 shows mixed response - two liver lesions reduced, one increased from 2.1cm to 2.8cm

status_updates.value: Metastatic pancreatic mixed acinar-endocrine carcinoma with stable disease but significant treatment-related neuropathy requiring change in regimen
Mixed response with stable primary tumor but variable liver metastases response
Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy affecting fine motor function
Discontinuing nab-paclitaxel, continuing single-agent gemcitabine at full dose
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 8 weeks with CA19-9 monitoring each cycle
Review in 3 weeks pre-cycle 2 of modified regimen
